translations.text: By those who range themselves in rows;
by those who reprove severely,
and those who recite the Exhortation;<sup foot_note="180690">1</sup>
surely your God is One,<sup foot_note="180691">1</sup>
the Lord of the heavens and the earth and of whatever lies between the two, the Lord<sup foot_note="180692">1</sup> of the Easts.<sup foot_note="180693">2</sup>
We have adorned the lower heaven with the adornment of the stars<sup foot_note="180694">1</sup>
and have protected it from every rebellious satan.<sup foot_note="180695">1</sup>
These satans cannot listen to what transpires in the High Council for they are pelted away from every side
and are repelled. Theirs is an unceasing chastisement.
And if any is able to snatch a fragment, he is pursued by a piercing flame.<sup foot_note="180696">1</sup>
So ask them (that is, human beings): “Were they harder to create than the objects We created?”<sup foot_note="180697">1</sup> We created them from sticky clay.<sup foot_note="180698">2</sup>
You marvel (at the wondrous creations of Allah) and they scoff at it,
and when they are admonished, they pay no heed;
and if they see any Sign, they laugh it away
and say: “This is nothing but plain sorcery.<sup foot_note="180699">1</sup>
Is it ever possible that after we die and are reduced to dust and (a skeleton of) bones, we will be raised to life?
And so also shall our forefathers of yore be raised to life?”
Tell them: “Yes; and you are utterly helpless (against Allah).”<sup foot_note="180700">1</sup>
There will be a single stern rebuff and lo, they will be observing with their own eyes (all that they had been warned against).<sup foot_note="180701">1</sup>
They will then say: “Woe for us. This is the Day of Judgement.”
“Yes, this is the Day of Final Decision that you used to deny as a lie.”<sup foot_note="180702">1</sup>
(Then will the command be given): “Muster all the wrong-doers<sup foot_note="180703">1</sup> and their spouses<sup foot_note="180704">2</sup> and the deities whom they used to serve
apart from Allah,<sup foot_note="180705">1</sup> and direct them to the path of Hell,
and detain them there; they will be called to account.
How is it that you are not helping one another?
Indeed, today they are surrendering themselves completely.”<sup foot_note="180706">1</sup>
They will then turn towards each other (and start wrangling).
(The followers will say to their leaders): “You used to come to us from the right hand.”<sup foot_note="180707">1</sup>
They will say: “Nay, you yourselves were not the ones who would believe.
We had no power over you. You were a rebellious people,
and so we became deserving of the Word of our Lord that we shall be made to suffer chastisement.
So we led you astray; we ourselves were strayed.”<sup foot_note="180708">1</sup>
On that Day, they will all share the chastisement.<sup foot_note="180709">1</sup>
Thus do We treat the culprits.
Whenever it was said to them: “There is no true deity apart from Allah,” they waxed proud
and said: “Shall we forsake our deities for the sake of a distracted poet?”
(They say so although) he brought the Truth and confirmed the veracity of the Messengers.<sup foot_note="180710">1</sup>
(They will be told): “You shall taste the grievous chastisement.
You will only be recompensed according to your deeds.”
But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).
For them awaits a known provision,<sup foot_note="180711">1</sup>
a variety of delicious fruits; and they shall be honoured<sup foot_note="180712">1</sup>
in the Gardens of Bliss.
They will be seated upon couches set face to face;
a cup filled with wine<sup foot_note="180713">1</sup> from its springs,<sup foot_note="180714">2</sup> will be passed around to them;<sup foot_note="180715">3</sup>
white, sparkling (wine), a delight to the drinkers.
There will neither be any harm in it for their body nor will it intoxicate their mind.<sup foot_note="180716">1</sup>
Theirs shall be wide-eyed maidens<sup foot_note="180717">1</sup> with bashful, restrained glances,<sup foot_note="180718">2</sup>
so delicate as the hidden peel under an egg's shell.<sup foot_note="180719">1</sup>
Then some of them will turn to others, and will ask each other.
One of them will say: “I had a companion in the world
who used to say: �Are you also one of those who confirm the Truth (of life after death)?
After we are dead and have become all dust and bones shall we still be requited?'<sup foot_note="180720">1</sup>
He will say: �Do you wish to know where he is now?'
Then he will look downwards, and will see him in the depths of Hell.
He will say to him: �By Allah, you almost ruined me.
But for Allah's favour, I should be one of those who have been mustered here.<sup foot_note="180721">1</sup>
So, are we not going to die,
except for our first death? And shall we suffer no chastisement?'”<sup foot_note="180722">1</sup>
Surely this is the supreme triumph.
For the like of it should the workers work.
Is this a better hospitality or the tree of al-Zaqqum?<sup foot_note="180723">1</sup>
We have made this tree a trial for the wrong-doers.<sup foot_note="180724">1</sup>
It is a tree that grows in the nethermost part of Hell.
Its spathes are like the heads of satans.<sup foot_note="180725">1</sup>
(The people of Hell) will surely eat of it, filling their bellies with it.
Then on top of it they will have a brew of boiling water.
Then their return will be to the same blazing Hell.<sup foot_note="179897">1</sup>
These are the ones who found their fathers steeped in error,
and they are running in their footsteps.
Before them a multitude of people of olden times had erred,
and We had sent among them Messengers to warn them.
Observe, then, what was the end of those that had been warned,
except for the chosen servants of Allah?<sup foot_note="180726">1</sup>
Noah<sup foot_note="180727">1</sup> had called upon Us (earlier).<sup foot_note="180728">2</sup> See, how excellent We were in answering him!
We delivered him and his household from the great calamity;<sup foot_note="180729">1</sup>
and made his offspring the only ones to survive,<sup foot_note="180730">1</sup>
and We established for him a good name among posterity.
Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.<sup foot_note="180731">1</sup>
Thus do We reward all those who do good.
Surely he was one of Our truly believing servants.
Thereafter We caused the others to be drowned.
Abraham was on the self-same way (as Noah).
When he came to his Lord with a pure heart,<sup foot_note="180732">1</sup>
and said to his father and his people:<sup foot_note="180733">1</sup> “Whom do you worship?
Is it false deities that you want to serve rather than Allah?
What do you think of the Lord of the whole Universe?”<sup foot_note="180734">1</sup>
Then<sup foot_note="180735">1</sup> he looked carefully at the stars<sup foot_note="180736">2</sup>
and said: “I am sick.”<sup foot_note="180737">1</sup>
So turning their backs, they went away from him.<sup foot_note="180738">1</sup>
Then he went quietly to the (temple of the deities) and said: “What is the matter with you, why do you not eat?<sup foot_note="180739">1</sup>
What is the matter with you, why do you not speak?”
Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand,
whereupon people came to him running.<sup foot_note="180740">1</sup>
Abraham said to them: “Do you worship what you yourselves have carved with your own hands
while it is Allah Who has created you and all that you make?”
They spoke among themselves: “Build him a pyre and then throw him into the furnace.”
They had contrived an evil plan against him, but We abased them all.<sup foot_note="180741">1</sup>
Abraham said:<sup foot_note="180742">1</sup> “I am going to my Lord;<sup foot_note="180743">2</sup> He will guide me.
Lord, grant me a righteous son.”<sup foot_note="180744">1</sup>
(In response to this prayer) We gave him the good news of a prudent boy;<sup foot_note="180745">1</sup>

and when he was old enough to go about and work with him, (one day) Abraham said to him: “My son, I see in my dream that I am slaughtering you.<sup foot_note="180746">1</sup> So consider (and tell me) what you think.”<sup foot_note="180747">2</sup> He said: “Do as you are bidden.<sup foot_note="180748">3</sup> You will find me, if Allah so wills, among the steadfast.”
When both surrendered (to Allah's command) and Abraham flung the son down on his forehead,<sup foot_note="180749">1</sup>
We cried out:<sup foot_note="180750">1</sup> “O Abraham,
you have indeed fulfilled your dream.<sup foot_note="180751">1</sup> Thus do We reward the good-doers.”<sup foot_note="180752">2</sup>
This was indeed a plain trial.<sup foot_note="180753">1</sup>
And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,<sup foot_note="180754">1</sup>
and We preserved for him a good name among posterity.
Peace be upon Abraham.
Thus do We reward the good-doers.
Surely he was one of Our believing servants.
And We gave him the good news of Isaac,<sup foot_note="180755">1</sup> a Prophet and among the righteous ones.<sup foot_note="180756">2</sup>
And We blessed him and Isaac. Among the offspring of the two some did good and some plainly wronged themselves.
Verily We bestowed Our favours on Moses and Aaron
and We delivered both of them and their people from the great calamity.<sup foot_note="180757">1</sup>
We succoured them, and they gained the upper hand (against their enemies).
We granted them a Clear Book,
and showed them the Straight Way,
and preserved for them a good name among posterity.
Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.
Thus do We reward the good-doers.
Surely both of them were among Our believing servants.
Surely, Elias too was among the Messengers.<sup foot_note="180758">1</sup>
(Call to mind) when he said to his people: “Will you not fear Allah?
Do you call upon Baal<sup foot_note="180759">1</sup> and forsake the Best of the Creators?
Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors of yore.”
But they denounced him as a liar, so they will surely be arraigned (for punishment),
except Allah's chosen servants.<sup foot_note="180760">1</sup>
We preserved a good name for him among posterity.<sup foot_note="180761">1</sup>
Peace be upon Elias.<sup foot_note="180762">1</sup>
Thus do We reward the good-doers.
He was one of Our believing servants.
And Lot too was one of the Messengers.
(Call to mind) when We delivered him and all his kinsfolk,
except for an old woman who was among those that stayed behind.<sup foot_note="180763">1</sup>
Then We utterly destroyed the rest of them.
You pass by their desolate habitations in the morning<sup foot_note="180764">1</sup>
and at night. Do you still not understand?
And Jonah too was one of the Messengers.<sup foot_note="180765">1</sup>
Call to mind when he fled to the laden ship,<sup foot_note="180766">1</sup>
cast lots, and was among the losers.
Then a fish swallowed him, and he was blameworthy.<sup foot_note="180767">1</sup>
Had he not been one of those who glorify Allah,<sup foot_note="180768">1</sup>
he would certainly have remained in its belly till the Day of Resurrection.<sup foot_note="180769">1</sup>
But We threw him on a wide bare tract of land while he was ill;<sup foot_note="180770">1</sup>
and caused a gourd tree<sup foot_note="180771">1</sup> to grow over him,
and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,<sup foot_note="180772">1</sup>
and they believed. So We let them enjoy life for a while.<sup foot_note="180773">1</sup>
So ask their opinion:<sup foot_note="180774">1</sup> “(Are you convinced) that your Lord should have daughters and you should have sons?<sup foot_note="180775">2</sup>
Did We create the angels as females the while they witnessed?”
Behold, it is one of their fabrications that they say:
“Allah has begotten.” They are liars!
Did He choose daughters rather than sons?
What is the matter with you that you make such strange judgements?
Will you then not take heed?
Do you have any clear authority for such claims?
Bring your Book, if you are truthful.<sup foot_note="180776">1</sup>
They have established a kinship between Allah and the angels;<sup foot_note="180777">1</sup> and the angels know well that these people will be arraigned (as culprits).
(They say): “Exalted be Allah above what they attribute to Him,
all of them except the chosen servants of Allah.
So you and your deities
shall not be able to tempt anyone away from Allah
except him who shall roast in the Blazing Fire.<sup foot_note="180778">1</sup>
As for us, there is none but has an appointed station.<sup foot_note="180779">1</sup>
Verily we range ourselves in rows (as humble servants)
and we are of those who glorify Allah.”
They used to say before:
“If only we had the Reminder which had been granted to the people of yore
we would surely have been Allah's chosen servants.”<sup foot_note="180780">1</sup>
But when it came to them, they rejected it. They shall soon come to know (the end of such an attitude).
We have already given Our promise to Our Messengers
that they shall certainly be succoured,
and that Our hosts shall triumph.<sup foot_note="180781">1</sup>
So, (O Prophet), leave them alone for a while,
and see, and soon they too shall see.<sup foot_note="180782">1</sup>
Do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?
When that chastisement will descend upon their courtyard, evil shall that Day be for those who had been warned.
Leave them alone for a while,
and see; and they too shall soon see.
Exalted be your Lord, the Lord of Glory, above what they attribute to Him,
and peace be upon the Messengers,
and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universe.
